] are also presented. The distribution of the HAp nanoparticles covered with EOs became
non-uniform, and it seemed that the porosity of the HAp nanoparticles increased. An obvious increase
in porosity was noticed for HAp-L samples, while a clear change in the porosity of HAp-B samples
was not observed. This behavior could suggest that basil EO had poor adsorption on the surface of

determined by the BET method. The nitrogen physisorption results, including the S

The BET surface areas increased fromHAp to HAp-L. The S
value for HAp-B is close to that
of HAp. As expected, the pore volume V
increased from HAp to HAp-L. The results regarding the
porosity of the materials were similar to those observed by SEManalysis. These materials could have
high potential for use in a variety of applications, due to the possibility of obtaining particles with a

groups of the apatitic structure appear at 470 cm

fromthe water absorbed into the HAp structure.

the C=C stretching vibration and the 1740 cm
